did.unittitle: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Ornithology Department records

bioghist.p: The Academy of Natural Sciences maintains an ornithological collection of nearly 200,000 study skins and 15,000 tissue samples. Of great historical importance, specimens in the collection predate the founding of the Academy in 1812 and include important early bird collections from such famous collectors as Alexander Wilson, John Audubon, and John Gould. Staff of the department care for and maintain the ornithology collection and conducts research on the evolutionary biology of birds.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the Ornithology Department of the Academy of Natural Sciences. Records related to specimens in the collection include: 18 volumes of accession books of ornithological specimens (up to 1997) and eight microfilm reels of the accession books (accession # 000001 to #175726); a record book of specimens in the Maple Avenue collection (1889-1896); card files for skeletons housed in Ornithology; specimen tags removed from specimens; records of South American species, including a card file of specimens collected by M.A. Carriker and Rodolphe Meyer de Schauensee; and field data sheets for specimens collected in Washington, Oregon, California, and Peru during J. Peter Myer's Shorebirds study. The Shorebirds study materials also include instructions for collecting and preserving specimens. Material related to the Delaware Valley Ornithological Club (DVOC) includes: a handwritten inventory of the DVOC Collection donated to the Academy; Delaware Valley Birding Hotline files, including transcripts of the hotline messages (1974-1977 and 1993), correspondence, records of financial contributions to the hotline, and telephone instructions; and correspondence between Frank Gill and the DVOC, 1962-1980, much of it about the relationship between the two organizations. Other records in the collection include news releases about the Pennsylvania Breeding Bird Atlas project 1986-1987; correspondence of John Hawley Foster, 1952-1985, about birding trips and Foster's financial support of Academy ornithology projects; and lab notebooks from Frank Gill and Fred Sheldon, 1975-1992, containing notes on their bird DNA studies.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: Melbourne A. Carriker field notes, Delaware Valley Ornithological Club records, Frank B. Gill papers, R. M. de Schauensee papers, and C. Chandler Ross papers.
